Label: globotriaosylceramide
Comment: also known as CD77, Gb3, and ceramide trihexoside</br>AKA Gal-α(1-4)-Gal-Glc-Cer

Label: SCARB2
Comment: AKA scavenger receptor class B, member 2/ lysosomal intergral membrane protein 2

Label: NPC1
Comment: AKA scavenger receptor class B, member 2/ lysosomal intergral membrane protein 2

Label: NPC2
Comment: AKA scavenger receptor class B, member 2/ lysosomal intergral membrane protein 2

Label: LIPA
Comment: AKA scavenger receptor class B, member 2/ lysosomal intergral membrane protein 2

Label: HEXA
Comment: Hexosaminidase A; HEXA and the cofactor GM2 activator protein catalyze the degradation of the GM2 gangliosides

Label: sphingomyelinase
Comment: Sphingomyelin phosphodiesterase (also known as neutral sphingomyelinase, sphingomyelinase, or SMase)

Label: glucosylceramide-beta-glucosidase
Comment: Based on disorder (Goucher), this enzyme is assumed to be GBA)

Label: Sap-B
Comment: Sap-B is assumed to represent Saposin-B, which 'stimulates the hydrolysis of galacto-cerebroside sulfate by arylsulfatase A (EC 3.1.6.8), GM1 gangliosides by beta-galactosidase (EC 3.2.1.23) and globotriaosylceramide by alpha-galactosidase A (EC 3.2.1.22). Saposin-B forms a solubilizing complex with the substrates of the sphingolipid hydrolases.' Source: https://www.uniprot.org/uniprotkb/P07602/entry</br>Alternative names: Cerebroside sulfate activator (CSAct) DispersinSphingolipid activator protein 1 (SAP-1) Sulfatide/GM1 activator

Label: Sap-B
Comment: Sap-B is assumed to represent Saposin-B, which 'stimulates the hydrolysis of galacto-cerebroside sulfate by arylsulfatase A (EC 3.1.6.8), GM1 gangliosides by beta-galactosidase (EC 3.2.1.23) and globotriaosylceramide by alpha-galactosidase A (EC 3.2.1.22). Saposin-B forms a solubilizing complex with the substrates of the sphingolipid hydrolases.' Source: https://www.uniprot.org/uniprotkb/P07602/entry</br>Alternative names: Cerebroside sulfate activator (CSAct) DispersinSphingolipid activator protein 1 (SAP-1) Sulfatide/GM1 activator

Label: Sap-C
Comment: Sap-C is assumed to represent Saposin-C, which ' stimulates the hydrolysis of glucosylceramide by beta-glucosylceramidase (EC 3.2.1.45) and galactosylceramide by beta-galactosylceramidase (EC 3.2.1.46). Saposin-C apparently acts by combining with the enzyme and acidic lipid to form an activated complex, rather than by solubilizing the substrate.' Source:[https://www.uniprot.org/uniprotkb/P07602/entry]</br>'Saposin C is one of four homologous proteins derived from sequential cleavage of the saposin precursor protein, prosaposin.' [PMID:22652185]</br>Alternative names: A1 activatorCo-beta-glucosidaseGlucosylceramidase activatorSphingolipid activator protein 2 (SAP-2)</br>Amino acid sequence of saposin C: C'-SDVYCEVCEFLVKEVTKLIDNNKTEKEILDAFDKMCSKLPKSLSEECQEVVDTYGSSILSILLEEVSPELVCSMLHLCSG-N'  [PMID:22652185]
